info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 27 at 5:43PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Warren, northeastern Lehigh, southeastern Carbon, southwestern Monroe and Northampton Counties through 615 PM EDT... At 542 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Danielsville, or 12 miles east of Lehighton, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Allentown, Easton, Mount Pocono, Bethlehem, Forks, Northampton, Wilson, Nazareth, Palmerton, Bangor, Pen Argyl, Wind Gap, Bath, Harmony, Alpha, Belfast, West Easton, Tatamy, East Bangor and Steuben. This includes the following highways... Northeast Extension near mile marker 81, and between mile markers 83 and 87. Interstate 78 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 73 and 76. Interstate 78 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 1, and between mile markers 4 and 5. Interstate 80 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 295 and 311. Interstate 380 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 2. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
